alert.note: Alert for Stewart (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 08 at 5:24PM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southern Stewart County through 600 PM EDT... At 523 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was near Sanford, or 10 miles northeast of Georgetown, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Up to 40 mph wind, frequent cloud to ground lightning and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Heavy rain may cause temporary street flooding especially in poor drainage areas. Locations impacted include... Lumpkin, Sanford, Westville and Providence Canyon State Park. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: People outdoors should seek shelter immediately. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Motorists should slow down and be prepared for possible loss of control due to hydroplaning.
